text: Why not use theme settings instead of HubDB?
what an interesting way to use hubdb… Doesn’t seem like the best way to be honest, but I’m second guessing myself on that statement. Curious why you chose that route

Im building a Custom React CRM Card for the tickets view.
I am attempting to use the engagements endpoint to list note content. When running the dev server I get this error:
```[ERROR] Error: Cannot fetch context object properties: StatusCodeError: 403 - {"status":"error","message":"This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.","correlationId":"924f9039-f285-402a-8fe0-434a3928a5aa","errors":[{"message":"One or more of the following scopes are required.","context":{"requiredScopes":["tickets"]}}],"links":{"scopes":"<https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>"},"category":"MISSING_SCOPES"}```
My App.json includes the "tickets" scope (see screenshot) and has been rebuilt and run multiple times.
``` "scopes": [
    "crm.objects.contacts.read",
    "crm.objects.contacts.write",
    "crm.objects.custom.read",
    "crm.objects.custom.write",
    "crm.objects.deals.read",
    "crm.objects.deals.write",
    "tickets"
  ],```
Im not seeing or remembering that this scope needs to be set anywhere else.

Some additional context :
• this is the second CRM card on this App
• the first works as expected

Following up,:
The App API calls shows a successful despite the returned error.

This was an attempt to diagnose a hubdb issue, which magically resolved after 6 1/2 hours, causing a lot of stress. If you want to go into the why... I don't use any drag and drop modules, they are all hand coded. I wanted a single Style source (connecting to bootstrap classes) to enable marketers to edit button colors, font colors and any of the UI that bootstrap (our framework) provides. I can accomplish this using the HubDB Row field. The themes style fields are too limited.
I've attempted to use the tickets scope on a completely new card and get the same error. Might this be a HS bug?
<@UE4B3GQNS> There was a small glitch in the pre-rendering service yesterday for few hours for hubdb dynamic pages in few portals  and it was fixed...
